mav_sim.chap4.mav_dynamics module¶

mavDynamics

  • this file implements the dynamic equations of motion for MAV

  • use unit quaternion for the attitude state

part of mavPySim

  • Beard & McLain, PUP, 2012

  • Update history:

    12/20/2018 - RWB

class mav_sim.chap4.mav_dynamics.MavDynamics(Ts: float, state: DynamicState | None = None)¶

Bases: object

Implements the dynamics of the MAV using vehicle inputs and wind

external_set_state(new_state: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]) → None¶

Loads a new state

property forces: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]¶

Getter for the forces variable

get_euler() → tuple[float, float, float]¶

Returns the roll, pitch, and yaw Euler angles based upon the state

get_fm_struct() → ForceMoments¶

Returns the latest forces and moments calculated in dynamic update

get_state() → ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]¶

Returns the state

get_struct_state() → DynamicState¶

Returns the current state in a struct format

Outputs:

DynamicState: The latest state of the mav

property moments: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]¶

Getter for the moments variable

property ts_simulation: float¶

Getter for the ts_simulation

update(delta: MsgDelta, wind: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], time_step: float | None = None) → None¶

Integrate the differential equations defining dynamics, update sensors

Parameters:

  • delta – (delta_a, delta_e, delta_r, delta_t) are the control inputs

  • wind – the wind vector in inertial coordinates

mav_sim.chap4.mav_dynamics.forces_moments(state: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], delta: MsgDelta, Va: float, beta: float, alpha: float) → ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]¶

Return the forces on the UAV based on the state, wind, and control surfaces

Parameters:

  • state – current state of the aircraft

  • delta – flap and thrust commands

  • Va – Airspeed

  • beta – Side slip angle

  • alpha – Angle of attack

Returns:

Forces and Moments on the UAV (in body frame) np.matrix(fx, fy, fz, Mx, My, Mz)

mav_sim.chap4.mav_dynamics.gravitational_force(quat: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]) → ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]¶

Computes the gravitational force on the aircraft in the body frame

Parameters:

quat – 4x1 quaternion vector

Returns:

The gravitational force due to gravity

Return type:

types.Vector

mav_sim.chap4.mav_dynamics.lateral_aerodynamics(p: float, r: float, Va: float, beta: float, aileron: float, rudder: float) → tuple[ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]]¶

Computes the lateral aerodynamic force and torque in the body frame, each as a 3x1 vector

Note that the aerodynamic parameters are obtained from MAV (imported above). For example, to get the lateral aerodynamic coefficient for force due to side slip angle, you would use

MAV.C_Y_beta

Parameters:

  • p – roll rate - body frame - i

  • r – yaw rate - body frame - k

  • Va – Airspeed

  • beta – Side slip angle

  • alpha – Angle of attack

  • aileron – aileron command

  • rudder – rudder command

Returns:

(f_lat,torque_lat)

f_lat: The lateral aerodynamic force torque_lat: The lateral aerodynamic torque

Return type:

tuple[types.Vector, types.Vector]

mav_sim.chap4.mav_dynamics.longitudinal_aerodynamics(q: float, Va: float, alpha: float, elevator: float) → tuple[ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]]¶

Computes the longitudinal aerodynamic force and torque in the body frame, each as a 3x1 vector.

The lift model used combines the common linear behavior with a flat plat model for stall (4.9 - 4.10)

The drag model combines parasitic and induced drag (4.11)

Note that the aerodynamic parameters are obtained from MAV (imported above). For example, to get the aerodynamic coefficient of lift due to the angle of attack, you would use

MAV.C_L_alpha

Parameters:

  • p – roll rate - body frame - i

  • r – yaw rate - body frame - k

  • Va – Airspeed

  • beta – Side slip angle

  • alpha – Angle of attack

  • aileron – aileron command

  • rudder – rudder command

Returns:

(f_lon,torque_lon)

f_lon: The lateral aerodynamic force torque_lon: The lateral aerodynamic torque

Return type:

tuple[types.Vector, types.Vector]

mav_sim.chap4.mav_dynamics.motor_thrust_torque(Va: float, delta_t: float) → tuple[float, float]¶

compute thrust and torque due to propeller (See addendum by McLain)

Parameters:

  • Va – Airspeed

  • delta_t – Throttle command

Returns:

Propeller thrust Q_p: Propeller torque

Return type:

T_p

mav_sim.chap4.mav_dynamics.update_velocity_data(state: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], wind: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]] = array([[0.], [0.], [0.], [0.], [0.], [0.]])) → tuple[float, float, float, ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]]¶

Calculates airspeed, angle of attack, sideslip, and velocity wrt wind

Parameters:

state – current state of the aircraft

Returns:

Airspeed alpha: Angle of attack beta: Side slip angle wind_inertial_frame: Wind vector in inertial frame

Return type:

Va
